subject: Re: [junit] TestSetup
msgSnippet: Mike, Vladimir said the same thing.  So, the question becomes what s the difference between the environments .  I have a feeling it s because we are using
messageBody:
Mike,

Vladimir said the same thing. So, the question becomes 'what's the difference
between the environments'. I have a feeling it's because we are using Eclipse.
I will do some more investigation and let the group know what I find.

=jason

--- Mike Clark <mike@...> wrote:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> > I am trying to do some one time setup, wrapping my suite in a TestSetup
> > instance. I add this Test to my overall suite, look in the suite and can
> see
> > the test cases scheduled there, but they don't get run. The oneTimeSetUp()
> > method gets called, but none of the "public void testYYY()" methods get
> called.
> >
> > What's the deal?
> >
> > =jason
> >
> > Here's a sample:
> >
> > public class AllTests {
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("All Tests");
> > suite.addTest(OneTimeSetUpTestSuite());
> > suite.addTest(<all other test cases and suites>);
> > return suite;
> > }
> > public static Test OneTimeSetUpTestSuite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTest(new TestSuite(SomeTestCase.class));
> > TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite) {
> > public void setUp() {
> > SomeTestCase.oneTimeSetUp();
> > }
> > };
> > return wrapper;
> > }
> >
> > ...TestRunner code...
> > }
> >
>
> Hi Jason,
>
> For what it's worth, I copied this code nearly verbatim to wrap one of my
> test
> cases, and it worked as expected.
>
> Mike
>
> --
> Mike Clark
> Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
> http://www.clarkware.com
> 720.851.2014
>
>
>
